div.l: For herbergh and ese / as for ther peny
The myller seid ageyn̄ / yif ther be any
Suche as it is / yit shul ye haue your part
Myn hous is streit / but ye haue lerned art
Ye can bi argumentis / make a place
A myle brood / of twenty feet of space
Lat se nowe / if this place may suffice
Or make it rommer wᵗyth speche as is your guyse
Now Symond seyd Iohn / bi seynt Cuthberd
Aay is thou mery / that this is wel answerd
I haue herd said / me sal take of twa thynges
Suche as he fynt / or take suche as he brynges
But specially / y pray the hoost dere
Gete vs som mete and drynke / and make vs cheer͗e
And we wol payen / trewly at the fulle
Wyth empty honde / men may noon hawkys tulle
Loo her our syluer / al redy for to spende
This myller͗e to the toıı̄un / his douhter sende
For ale and bred / and rosted hem a goos
And bond her hors / it sholde no more go loos
And in his owne chambyr he maad a bed
Wyth sheetꝭys / and wᵗyth chalons wel y spred
Nat from his owne bed / ten feet or twelue
His douhtir / hadde a bedde bi hir selve
Ryht in the same chambyr bi and bi
It myht be no bet / and cause why
Ther was no rommer͗e herbergh in the place
They sopen̄ / and thei speken̄ hem to salace
And drynken ovir strong ale / at the best
Aboute mydnyht / went they to rest
